page.title: 11Population Growth
page.content: {Linwood}and its surrounding area was once tree covered. Monks from{Paisley {Abbey}used some of the area as farmland. The whole area eventually became farmland with a few scattered farm holdings. However, as the years passed, the population grew with people coming from the nearby small town of{Inkerman}. Despite the fact that the village had only two main streets, its population continued to grow. By the late 1960s a new car factory was built and new housing had to be built to house the incoming workers. The increase in population left Linwood short of amenities. This was overcome by the building of a new library, community centre, shopping centre and sports complex. However, in 1982 disaster struck when the car factory closed, making 3000 people unemployed.
